website_summaries.verdict: A large outdoor clock that will never need any maintenance from you apart from the occasional battery change.
pros: Radio-controlled clock that automatically adjusts for daylight savings and stays accurate to the second
cons: There have been a few reported instances of the clock setting itself to the wrong time

customer_reviews.title: his clock, work great and keeps perfect time and looks really good in backyard, but no temp or humidity readiung
customer_reviews.text: Very very happy with this clock, work great and keeps perfect time and looks really good in backyard patio, well after several months I just figured out that the thermometer and humidity deials are not working at all. Today I placed both dials to 0 ajhnd one hour they have not moved, temp right now 81 and humidity 17 If anybody know what I may be doing wrong let me know please including you Amazon since there is no way to get to the seller since it was you 05112018
customer_reviews.author: Lisandro E. Roque

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Have had this "La Crosse Technology WT-3181PL-INT 18 inch Atomic Outdoor Clock with Temperature & Humidity" for 10 months now. The clock still works and syncs on its own accurately, but the humidity and temperature gauges stopped working (not dead batteries). The clock is installed on an exterior wall of the house and is not directly exposed to harsh elements but is outdoors. Is a good looking clock but unfortunately the gauges are not durable enough.
customer_reviews.author: Shane R.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using my clock indoors exclusively. I wanted an “atomic” clock that kept accurate time, was easy to read, could measure temp & humidity, & was made with metal, not plastic, surrounding the clock face. I have other LaCrosse technology clocks. Their digital clocks with temp sensors still work for time & indoor temp, but the outdoor temp sensors died within a few weeks of putting them outdoors (protected under the roof above our front door). That’s probably due to the high heat & humidity in the area of NC where we live. The only thing missing for me is a second hand. Anyway, the clock has everything else I wanted & it looks great on my livingroom wall.
customer_reviews.author: Croknitgirl

customer_reviews.title: When it arrived the minute hand was dislodged, the ...
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived the minute hand was dislodged, the temp gauge read 50 when the actual temp that day was 80, and the humidity gauge said 10 percent. I live in Delaware, the last time the humidity was that low here was when a T-Rex accidentally farted next to a fire. If you are going to make cheap stuff at least put a little effort into packaging for shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! It was delivered October 3, 2017 and hung under patio roof at our Mesa, AZ home for less than one month till we brought it in the house when we returned to our Illinois home. Just returned to Mesa, placed the clock back outside on patio after arriving midday and when I went out this morning the hour hand was laying at the bottom of the clock.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, works well, could be sealed better.
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's an atomic clock and has both humidity as well as temp on the face. My only nit with it is for an outdoor clock, I've noticed after it rains that the interior face glass is a bit cloudy, which goes away after time, presumably when it dries out. It could be sealed better, but so far it hasn't failed and we're happy with having the 3 items of information (time, temp, humidity) on our balcony.
customer_reviews.author: J. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Does not want to keep time.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the clock for the looks and style. For the first week is was fine, then it stopped keeping time. We replaced the batteries, reset it and it was fine for a few days, then stopped again. When it was stopping all together, it was off by several hours or an hour. We checked and rechecked the DST and PST settings. It would go for a few days and then stop again. We got tired of setting and resetting, just to have it stop again. Had to to send it back for a refund. I'm hoping it is just a one off problem.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H

customer_reviews.title: Buying this clock again for patio
customer_reviews.text: Purchased same clock 12/2012 and love it. It was looking shabby so wanted a new one. It had a glitch but working still. I put the old one in my shed. Very hot and high humidity where I live, so jut wanted a new one. It's right out my back door, with large numbers, temperature and humidity. I like it changes time itself on daylight savings time cause its radio controlled.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fryoux

customer_reviews.title: Great clock, bad humidity and thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this only for the clock operation. I did not want the humidity or thermometer but had no choice. If I wanted them I would rate this one star because neither of them work. The humidity meter is always off when I compare it to a high quality meter, adjusting it makes no difference. The thermometer has the same issue, and has an additional problem that the needle is loose. However it looks great, keeps time well, and seems well built (other than the above comments). Since I only wanted a clock, I am keeping it and ignoring the humidity/thermometer problems.
customer_reviews.author: Garry & Julie

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Every now and then, a product is even better than expected. This clock is great! Setup was easy after watching the manufacturer’s video. The clock caught the signal very quickly after being placed in a western facing window. It now hangs outside on an east wall under the porch eves but still exposed to all kinds of weather and humidity. It has worked perfectly for several months and it’s easily seen from a distance. Plus it looks really nice. If it ever gives out, I’ll just turn around and get another one.
customer_reviews.author: C.V.

customer_reviews.title: so hanging it was easy. Even my 82 year old eyes can read ...
customer_reviews.text: It's HUGE, but very lightweight, so hanging it was easy. Even my 82 year old eyes can read it at a distance of 75 ft. Initial setting of time was easy, altho it took about five minutes to receive the WWVB signal. It's under a south-facing 15 ft.roof over an arbor, but there was no problem receiving the signal.I haven't calibrated the humidity of temperature gauges yet. Some reviews noted that the minute or hour hand has fallen off. Mine were fine.
customer_reviews.author: charles corum

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: When the clock arrived, two of the screws securing the back case were loose in the box. I should have returned it immediately but hoped for the best. I inserted the screws and tightened them. The clock did fine for about 3 weeks. Then the he big hand got stuck on the temperature guage hand. I unscrewed the case to un-stick the hands, and the time won't re-set correctly, once this had been done. I am old and disabled and unable to package the item for return and have ordered one of another brand. I have always thought this was a good brand, but no longer.
customer_reviews.author: William I. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrated and disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Clock does not work. We have set and reset it repeatedly but it keeps changing to several hours off, regardless of which time zone button we push. Very frustrated and disappointed. Update: Amazon sent out a replacement clock. Time works accurately but temperature and humidity don't work. Always says it's 0° and 100% humidity. Returning to Amazon and will look for another clock. Don't want your time and money buying this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: FACS_Lady_GA

customer_reviews.title: this clock is a dud.
customer_reviews.text: This clock was purchased April of this year (2018) does not work September 20th, lasted 5 months. cost me over $10.00 per month for use. China continues to send us junk, and retailers will not find another source to buy from. they are only interested in turning a large profit on this kind of junk. I had rather pay more and have a reliable product. what a shame.
customer_reviews.author: rt1944

customer_reviews.title: Nice clock
customer_reviews.text: I have this clock hanging outside on the side of my shed. It is somewhat protected from the weather as it is near the roof overhang. When I first put a battery in, the clock cycled round and round for a few moments then stopped and has been keeping perfect time ever since. Sets itself for daylight savings time. This is a very nice outdoor clock.
customer_reviews.author: Craig D

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and performing item!
customer_reviews.text: Love this clock! We have it outside and a bit protected by the roof overhang. It is very accurate and looks very good. Hoping it is as weatherproof as stated. We will see how it makes it through the winter months. The temp and humidity dials are useless unless the clock is much closer to the ground because they cannot be read at much of a distance. Barring this, we are happy with the clock.
customer_reviews.author: GTO

customer_reviews.title: Stuck on the Hygrometer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this nice looking clock for our church playground. Next day I went out to check it and the hour hand was stuck BEHIND the hygrometer needle and I couldn't get inside it to do a thing about it. Returned it. Ordered a second identical clock. Seemed to run fine the first day. Second day went out AGAIN, the HOUR HAND IS STUCK UNDERNEATH THE HYGROMETER ARROW! Frustrating. I shook it and was able to move the clock hands and let time fast forward to test it. Each time, the hour hand drug on the hygrometer dial as it passed. I'll have to try a different clock.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. R.

customer_reviews.title: This is without question the BEST outdoor clock I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is without question the BEST outdoor clock I have ever purchased. I have run through numerous clocks that advertised their resistance to extreme heat or cold, and non of them came close to meeting their claims. I live in Dallas, TX and the heat in the summer time is constantly in the mid to upper 90s. The La Crosse clock has functioned flawlessly. Also, the temperature and barometric readings are always spot on. If you're looking for a reliable outdoor clock, this is the one to buy. RJC
customer_reviews.author: RJC

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS CLOCK!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS CLOCK! I wish this clock would have worked out for me. It is light weight and aesthetically pleasing to look at. Once I installed the batteries, the clock set itself to 4 o'clock which was incorrect and did not correct itself after several minutes. I decided to take the three AA batteries (required) out and begin again. I was shockingly surprised to find that all the batteries were extremely hot and 2 out of 3 of them had melted! I immediately returned this item, as it's unsafe and could have started a fire in my home! Scary! Perhaps a blessing for me that the clock didn't function properly from the get go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great clock!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loved this clock in every way! It did exactly what it said. Took a couple of days for the time to get right, but it got right all on its own! Keeps perfect time and you don't hear it at all! Have it on the back patio. Glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Sanders

customer_reviews.title: I love the thermometer and hygrometer (relative humidity) gauges as well
customer_reviews.text: I have this hanging right next to my shower in the bathroom, and it fogs up a little but with it being weather proof it doesn't effect anything. I love the thermometer and hygrometer (relative humidity) gauges as well. To set the time during initial setup, there is a button on the back and within 24 hours it automatically adjusts to the proper time using the radio frequencies. The cool thing is that with that auto-setting feature during the time-change of Daylight Savings it adjusts itself :)
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: 1st clock great 2nd clock not so good
customer_reviews.text: The 1st clock we had by this manufacture lasted 7 years. The 2nd clock by this manufacture is a piece of crapola. Time works well but the temperature and humidity are so off it is useless. We have tried to adjust but still wont work. You decide
customer_reviews.author: Mary Stockford

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this clock
customer_reviews.text: (wife replying) I bought this for my husbands bathroom. We have had a clock in our bathroom almost our whole adult life. Before we retired it was important to make it to work on time. But now since we have retired, it is just because we have always had one there and it seems strange to not have a clock in the bathroom. This clock is pretty good size. It is 18" in diameter. Nice and big and easy to read. Works great and keeps really good time. We also have the same clock in our kitchen even though it is an outdoor clock. I figured that would work best in a damp area like the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: LarryTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Hygrometer doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The humidity reading is always wrong on this which is one of the main reasons I bought this clock. It always says around 50% no matter what. We rarely get humidity anywhere near that in AZ. Don't waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: BuffaloBill

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival! Bought it for summer barbecue time and just took it out of the box. After two sets of new batteries still no movement. Following directions to leave outside on a wall after a week of fiddling, I guess garbage, my return window closed and they want a phone call. I work, not wait for someone on phone. Next time open and try right away. The last outdoor clock I purchased last year only lasted four months, does anyone build a reliable outdoor clock!
customer_reviews.author: Maurice

customer_reviews.title: It is just a clock not rocket science, but maybe you need a science degree to set.
customer_reviews.text: Needed an outdoor clock for our yard. This clock, while it works well, is highly visible and is accurate, is really inconvenient to programm. After reading the instructions,and all the ways the clock could loose satellites I opted to just set the time manually. Now it has the strangest directions "after removing the battery wait twenty minutes, then press the button 20 times, then hold the button while clock hands get to the correct time and release. It worked but I'm sure there was a reason to wait so long with no power, maybe some capacitor had to bleed off, really crazy. I only rated 3 stars because the programming ( satellite or manual) seemed ludicrous.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Bolger

customer_reviews.title: Hands fell off after 18 months 😮
customer_reviews.text: We had this clock hanging outside by the pool under protection from the elements for about a year. When i went out the other day (after not using our pool for about 6 months) I noticed that BOTH hands had fallen off and were sitting on the bottom of the clock inside the glass. What a bummer! I guess the Arizona heat was too much for this clock.
customer_reviews.author: DBark

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor clock!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second La Crosse atomic outdoor clock that I have bought. I have one on my front porch that I bought last year and this one is replacing one that I had in my backyard. I like that this one has the plastic frame because the one I was replacing was metal which rusted and stained the brick on the house. I am very happy with the looks and accuracy of this clock and that the time changes automatically in the spring and fall.
customer_reviews.author: Bestmom

customer_reviews.title: Works great, with a couple of adjustments
customer_reviews.text: We use it in our master bathroom. At first I thought the humidity and temp gauges we not working, but you can rotate them from the back to calibrate them. I also put rubber bumpers on the back to allow air flow behind it in order for the gauges to work correctly. (Just make sure you don’t put them on the back of the gauges) It took about a day to get the atomic signal. So now everything is functioning. I subtracted one star because I had to figure these hacks out myself.
customer_reviews.author: Sand Spur

customer_reviews.title: Working great thus far
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit to set itself, but works well. Previously purchased one for my sister in Arizona, hers seems to be working well for at least the last three years. Had a different brand before that stopped working after two years, but it didn’t have a cover for the battery like this one does.
customer_reviews.author: P jolly

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: The hour hand does not line up correctly. Can't tell if its 10:30 or 11:30 etc. I have tried to correct it manually by resetting. To no avail. Also the automatic daylight time does not reset automatically. This is not a battery problem. I would not recommend this item. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzman

customer_reviews.title: This Clock is Legit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this clock exactly 6 years and 5 months ago and I’m sad to say it has finally stopped moving it’s arms. I think I’ve had to replace the battery once. I’m buying a new one! I live in TX and this clock sits in the scorching sun, awesome thunderstorms and freezing temps. Lasted 6+ years. I love this clock!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great indoors and outdoors, takes the heat
customer_reviews.text: We've had this clock for three years now. We bought it for our pool area. From May-September it is outdoors on an exterior wall facing West. It is hot and sunny here, and this clock takes it like a pro. I was surprised just looking it up again that it's only 18 inches. It is very visible from 20 feet away. During the winter we bring it inside and hang it on a wall. I like it so much I'm considering a second one for that spot.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pettey

customer_reviews.title: REAL nice outdoor clock!
customer_reviews.text: The last outdoor clock lasted about 7 years. It finally died so we ordered this one. We had recently painted the outside of our home gray, so this clock fit the new color scheme perfectly! We LOVE the fact that it's synched to the Atomic Clock, so we don't have to do anything but change the batteries. It seems well built and we look forward to having it a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Terry W.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one week
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of the clock, however, it stopped working after I had it for one week, the hands stayed in one place and just clicked. Came home today and it fell off the wall and broke into about 8 pieces. I guess it was not meant to be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these the first was over five years ago for my home and it has been outside 365 days a year in severe heat and freezing cold and has functioned perfectly. Has a long battery life. Bought two more for the neighborhood pool and they are in use all summer but stored for the winter. They all work extremely well and never have to be set.
customer_reviews.author: D.K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great clock for outdoors, but not for temps
customer_reviews.text: This is our second clock like and we love it, however if you want it for the temps - it is never right or stops working all together.
customer_reviews.author: Janet H

customer_reviews.title: Great clock!
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this clock. It did exactly what was described in the manual when setting time. It's used on my front porch seating area. It has a compartment for 3 batteries so it will last supposedly 3 years without battery replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Raz

customer_reviews.title: So far it is working well in a very hot outdoor environment
customer_reviews.text: We tried several less expensive clocks for the wall on the back of our house where it would be visible from the swimming pool. All failed. This one seems to be doing ok, though it is only a month old. it so far has endured many days of mid 90s to 100+ temperatures. It is attractive. It is shaded, so that means it is not in direct sunlight. Only time will tell...uh, that was a pun....if it continues to perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Clock failed when attempting auto switch to Standard Daylight Time.
customer_reviews.text: On time change to Standard time the automatic reset kicked in. the hour hand jammed behind the temperature gauge axel, stopping the clock. This event effected the mechanism such that even with the hand freed, the clock hands perpetually clicked around the clock. After twenty four hours of non stop operation , I called the mfg. service number. "We''ll call you back" recording is as far as I got. Same answer the day after. I called Amazon customer service and received a new clock two days later. Clock seems OK so far. Mfg. called a week later. Thanks AMAZON! Did nor ret. call.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Last several years. Bought as replacement for one that we had over 5 years with direct exposure to elements.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Brittingham

customer_reviews.title: Where's the second hand?
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice large faced 'atomic' clock, but there's no second hand! The three battery power keeps this running for a long time between battery changes and allows for a battery change without losing the current time! It's a trick to hang this on the single hook mounting cutout, but it can be done. Just use a second person to hold the flashlight!
customer_reviews.author: AE2A

customer_reviews.title: Over a year now and still working as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This timepiece is mounted outdoors at a Kindergarten facility so that parents can see the time on which the Kindergarten is running (vice the different times various parents are using via smart phones, vehicle clocks, etc..).
customer_reviews.author: K Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Clock arrived with broken clock hand
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived and the clock hand was broken off and at the bottom of the clock. Thanks to Amazon, an easy return process, but very disappointed. I had this clock in the past and enjoyed it until it stopped working after several years. I assumed the replacement would be great.. Unfortunately it came broken and I had read previous reviews of the same concern.
customer_reviews.author: Amy J

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, durable, quality outdoor clock.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this clock on our patio for a couple months, and so far I like everything about it. Easy to set up. Looks great. Seems durable. Keeps accurate time. Temperature display is accurate. Easy to read. Nice size.
customer_reviews.author: doodlemom

customer_reviews.title: It's been almost one year and the 2nd one also works fine. Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the 2nd clock purchased from Amazon. The 1st one was bought 3 years ago and has been working well. It can handle the change of day-light-savings time twice each year without problem. Also, since it does not have the Second pointer that has to be moved every second, the battery lasts very long. The 1st one works so well so we bought the 2nd one. It's been almost one year and the 2nd one also works fine. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hour hand continually gets caught on Humidity hand.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as one of my neighbors had it and loved it, no problems. I have had it for 5 months and have had to continually take it down to move the hour hand off the humidity hand so it can successfully wind. Originally I had hoped it was a only a one time occurrence and wanted to have faith the clock would work, but now after countless resettings I am past the point of return or replacement. So please be mindful that you may experience issues with this product and that you shouldn't wait it out, just return it immediately or ask for for a replacement so you aren't stuck with a not functioning product.
customer_reviews.author: andrew a albright

customer_reviews.title: This is my second outdoor La Crosse clock in 8 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second outdoor La Crosse clock in 8 years. The last one had issues with our high humidity, and the paper face curled up in places. Eventually the first clock stopped synchronizing time, and I couldn't find any way to set the time manually. Sometimes the hands would just spin merrily around the clock face arbitrarily. Hoping this one lasts as long or longer.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Jones

customer_reviews.title: Time, Temp, humidity & it sets itself!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great clock for outdoors. Has an easy to read face. The time keeps perfectly in sync -- whatever time zone you're in, and whether daylight savings or not. The directions say it can take up to 24 hours to achieve correct time, but in just an hour, it was spot on! Love the fact we can see humidity -- we live in the desert and some days our humidity is 7!! Then it may creep up to a "muggy" 30! :-) All the features, combined with price (on Amazon -- I've seen it on several other sites for twice the price) make this a good buy. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: TravelPrincess

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This clock worked well the first two years. The thermometer and hydrometer worked well. After four years the thermometer and hydrometer still work well; however, the clock is struggling. When the battery weakens, the hands do not move past 7 o'clock. The other issue seems it no longer recognizes PST. I suspect the issue is with daylight savings because it tends to be off by 1 hour. The clock was on the back porch protected from rain. It isn't now in the garage and seems to be working fine. With a few fixes, this clock would be fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: FxPn

customer_reviews.title: when they say 1 year warranty, they're spot on.  That's how long it works
customer_reviews.text: Placed outdoors (under well covered soffit) and worked beautifully for about 1 year. Neighbors actually relied on it! However, after 1 year, it was another garbage bin item, "nothing we can do" after the warranty ran out. Replaced batteries, tried all repair tricks I knew for timepieces, no pun intended... waste of time. Suggest folks spend their money on a $9.99 model every few months, you'll be dollars ahead. Instantly. Your neighbors will thank you as well.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Maccio

customer_reviews.title: Great Outdoor Clock
customer_reviews.text: We've had this clock, hung outside, for more than 2 months. It's keeping great time and I'm thrilled that I won't have to change the time for Daylight Savings Time in the Fall. We've had rain almost everyday for the past month & it hasn't affected this clock at all. Am very pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Informed  Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Mixed emotions
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful clock, large enough to see from a distance, however I've had this clock about 3 weeks and have had to reset it multiple times, one time I actually had to open the front lens to clip the hr hand so it wouldn't get hung up on the humidity or temp hands. It doesn't look bad doing this however still I have had it be set to the wrong time zone even tho i set the time then press et for eastern time. So frustrating I just wanted a solid clock for outside.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Scally

customer_reviews.title: "Time" for a new piece
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my friend in Florida. Him and his wife love this outdoor clock. It sets it own time using satellites and holds accurate time. It is weather proof so far and looks great. Florida weather is brutal in the summer and so far this clock is holding up to all weather conditions without any problems. It is attached to the back side of his outdoor garage facing his rear yard just a few yards from the patio set. Time is easy to read and this is a classy looking clock. Very well made and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Grinch51

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description, poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: This was not an atomic clock, does not update via radio signal. Temperature read 45 degF when the actual temperature was 70. Display packaging is about 2”x20”x20”. Display package was shipped in a 20x20x20” cube with NO cushioning material. I had to pay shipping to return the clock as well as paying for proper packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Louvet

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor clock
customer_reviews.text: Easy to see and the temperature and humidity gauge are accurate enough for general information in my shop. The clock found the correct time quickly but didn't set to the proper time zone at first. After reading the trouble shooting section it mentioned holding the time zone button for several seconds. This immediately resolved the issue. The time zone button requires more than a short press of the button. We like the clock so well that we are going to purchase a second one for our porch.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Accurate; Looks Great; Amazing Quality
customer_reviews.text: This clock is amazingly accurate; good looking; and functional. It is my second. The first lasted 5 years 2 months and did not spend a single day indoors (Philadelphia climate). Fabulous quality and durability. GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: MalvernBound

customer_reviews.title: DURABLE!
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased two of these clocks previously and they are great, so I recently purchased another one. One thing you need to know is that they take 3 AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: James Tomasi

customer_reviews.title: You Won’t Regret Buying This Clock
customer_reviews.text: I Love being able to tell the time from a distance with this clock hung on my patio wall. The design is beautiful and being an atomic clock, the time is very accurate. This model is a big improvement over the previous model.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: La Crosse Outdoor Atomic Clock
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered on time. Good quality, easy to set up. I have had the clock for over a year now, battery still good and clock working great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Malatek

customer_reviews.title: CLOCK MUST BE PLACED ON WEST FACING WALL
customer_reviews.text: I live in south Louisiana and this clock gets its time from somewhere in Colorado. My intention was to keep this outdoors on an east facing wall, but it doesn't work well in that location. Instructions say to place it on a WEST FACING WALL so BUYER BE FOREWARNED. Wish I would have purchased a more simple clock.
customer_reviews.author: Maxanne in Covington, LA

customer_reviews.title: I own 2 of these clocks and I love them! They both are for outside and never ...
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 of these clocks and I love them! They both are for outside and never come in out of the weather. We got hit hard this winter and these clocks take a beating. I highly recommend it especially for outside. I have a neighbor that can do her gardening and look over into my yard and see what time it is!!!
customer_reviews.author: woodtickgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good Clock
customer_reviews.text: Second clock needed for another room. Really wanted for temperature gauge which seems to be playing catch up. Sometimes it's right on others not so much. May just need time to adjust to room.
customer_reviews.author: Julieann Hoskins

customer_reviews.title: Long life batteries and still going strong after 8 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this clock 8 years ago and have kept it outside in our backyard in the Texas sun ever since. I haven't had to change the batteries yet and it has kept perfectly synchronized time. The appearance of the outer metal trim has started to get a little aged and the top edge is beginning to show signs of some light corrosion but the clock otherwise is still performing great. Update: after 9 years, the metal frame is corroding heavily and the paper clock face behind the glass is beginning to peel and separate, but the clock continues to tell time accurately. I would probably buy another of the same model to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: Clock container
customer_reviews.text: This atomic outdoor clock from LaCrosse has been a very reliable source not only for time, but humidity and temperature readings as well. I have it hung outside in Galveston, TX where it has been subjected to all types of coastal conditions for over 8 years. However, a word of advice, if you plan to hang this clock outside, it's best to build a sealed container for it with a clear cover. By doing so helps prolong the life and the performance of the clock significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Skinny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Clock - Buying another one!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for 1.5 years and it still works great, resets time automatically, never skips a beat. I’m ordering another one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Have this out by the pool, it sets its self...how great is that!
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE! Rusted on hands where they attach to the face...not outdoor friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I received the clock for Christmas 2017. It’s been just over a year and the parts of the hands are rusting and discoloring when the hands attach to the clock are rusting on the face of the clock. I would love to have it stand up longer than a year. It’s big and easy to read. It looked great by the pool. For an outdoor clock, it’s not durable. I’m thinking it might be a lemon. I’d love to have one that is sealed and would withstand the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Clock!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd La Crosse clock. I had the first one for 10 years! I love how you never have to worry about setting the time. It does it itself!! Very good quality. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: so I thought an outdoor clock would be perfect for her
customer_reviews.text: I bought this clock as a gift for a friend that has a swimming pool. We always have to get out of the pool to look at our cellphones to see what time it is, so I thought an outdoor clock would be perfect for her. This clock has not been used yet and will not be until summer time, so I have no idea how it works. I know my friend seemed to like it real well. It came fast and looked like it was in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Blueskies

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the instructions are on their website - they weren't included
customer_reviews.text: It came without instructions. My hour hand was 30 minutes off so I removed the 6 screws from the back and the unit came apart easily so I could turn the hour hand to the correct position. When you put the battery in, the hands begin to move, but it took a couple of hours for the correct time to set itself, to the default time which is pacific time. Near the battery are 4 buttons for the 4 time zones. After the clock set itself to pacific time I pressed the ET button for Eastern Time and the clock moved ahead to my correct time. Hope that helps someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's big, and seems accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Seems accurate. Needed to get an atomic clock since every other timepiece is always a little off (I'm not a look at the computer, or my iPHONE for time person. Just never got in the habit). This is replacing a digital one I had that just seemed to quit. I like the size. Feels gigantic and I like that. Don't look at the temperature or humidity much, so no comment on accuracy. Haven't found the perfect place for it yet because of its size. I had my old on a shelf for so long that i automatically look in that direction. But, this clock is too big for the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mar

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: When placed against a house, it gives inconsistent temps. Varies by 15-20 degrees depending on the time of day. When first installed, it seemed to be stuck within a specific range but after a few days it measured normally. The clock stays synced as described
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Clock hands defective on last 2 replacement orders.  Loved the first clock that lasted 6 years.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these clocks for 6 years and just ordered another to replace it because moisture eventually got inside the clock and warped the face. The first clock kept perfect time using radio waves and I loved it. The first 2 replacements have been horrible. The hands immediately fell off on the first replacement and as you can see, the hands levels are miscalculated on the second replacement. The hands got stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Where is my product

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional and attractive. We have gone through too many outdoor clocks and finally this one works.
customer_reviews.author: Maryanne Healey

customer_reviews.title: Great/Not So Great
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of this clock. The first lasted at least five years until it died. We figured we got our money’s worth so tossed it and replaced it with the exact clock. Didn’t even last two months! Will not register the temperature. Time and humidity are fine, but I’m sad about not having the temperature. Don’t you know we judt missed the return time limit. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: It does have mounting holes
customer_reviews.text: I love this clock. I've had another clock on the woodshed out by the garden where my wife can see it, and that one got beat up quite a bit by the wind. This one is even bigger so I wanted more than a single hanger, and yes, the clock has three raised mounting pads on the back. The holes in the pads will accept #6 sheet metal screws for a solid, secure installation. I mounted mine on 1/8" Plexiglass sheet and then screwed that to a couple of 2X4's on the shed. Setting the time zone or replacing the battery means unmounting the clock, but that's not hard. It's huge and it looks great. I've attached some pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Watson

customer_reviews.title: THIS CLOCK IS WORTHLESS
customer_reviews.text: We waited the two nights for it to set as instructed since it is an "Atomic" clock. It worked for two days and has never keep the time correctly since. We have tried everything possible, new batteries, different position and it will not work. When it started working after the first two nights, we threw the box away or it would be going back.
customer_reviews.author: raven

customer_reviews.title: A very nice addition to any environment.
customer_reviews.text: This clock was purchased to replace an Atomix wall clock that finally quit. It has all the same features and works very well. It connected immediately to the Denver time source and has kept perfect time since. It was very easy to adjust the thermometer and hygrometer to the local conditions. It is very well made and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a two year investment
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these and each one lasted about two years. The failures were both electronic, not mechanical. The clocks were used outdoors but never exposed directly to rain. I really liked them while they were working but I won't be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: factoryguy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality control.
customer_reviews.text: The first clock had a broken back. The second clock’s time could not be set manually- I even called their customer service for help. The THIRD clock’s weather proof gasket was not over the glass edge. Even when put in place there was a gap between the glass & the edge of. They have NO QUALITY CONTROL !!! Do not buy ANY product from them.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Ivors

customer_reviews.title: Least amount of trouble Atomic clock I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I love this clock. I gave it as a gift to my parents who live in Florida with a pool. This is used in the outdoor patio next to it. The clock found the signal right away unlike a cheaper atomic clock I had. The instructions say to put on an exterior wall facing a certain direction but I just left it in my house and it found the time just fine that night. The other features are a great bonus as well. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bongard

customer_reviews.title: Poolside!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this outside by our pool for 2 months already and have not had any issues. I did ask my husband to make sure he takes it down each winter so it won't rust or get ruined. I'm so glad we have a clock and thermometer outside by our pool now!
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Hachey

customer_reviews.title: Hour Hand Becomes Loose
customer_reviews.text: For the first year or so the clock worked well - it may take a few days to sync the time - but now the hour hand constantly comes loose and "falls" to six. And there is now way to fasten/tighten the hand. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: John Stuppi

customer_reviews.title: Good garage clock
customer_reviews.text: The only negative is that the temp and humidity are too small. You have to get right up to it to see them. Nice looking, keeps good time and seems well made - at least so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dt

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CLOCK FOR LANAI BY POOL
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews before I ordered, and was a little concerned about the atomic setting, but I followed the instructions and waited for it to lock on to the master WWV clock source like it says. It set itself to the correct time and is still right on. It took a few hours as the manual said. It is on our covered lanai by the pool in north Florida and works fine with time, temperature and humidity. Our temperature varies sometimes from a low the high teens on winter nights to upper 90's with high humidity in the summer. Classy look, large Size and easy to read. Have been using for over a month and am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: LaCross 18" Atomic Clock w/temp
customer_reviews.text: The was a great clock as far as it made it. The hands started jerking and no longer operated correctly. I purchased this June 2017 didn't last three years??
customer_reviews.author: Carol B.

customer_reviews.title: The 'Old Guy's Dream' Clock
customer_reviews.text: Big, bold and super accurate. Mounted on the back wall of my garage, it can be read from most any location on my driveway. Given that it synchronzes display time with the NIST time standard, including automatically making DST adjustments, allowed me to mount it prominently in a higher location. The unit is quite sturdy and well built; the electronics package is very well protected so the 'indoor/outdoor' claim is a good one in my book! Happy, happy!! The unit arrived in great condition, and the applied packing method was very efficient - the blue whales and the giant redwoods would have been very proud of you!!
customer_reviews.author: Old Navy LDO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, accurate time, temp and humidity clock
customer_reviews.text: Big, bold and easy to read. Very handsome time, temp and humidity clock. I've had it outdoors for about 3 months, and it works like a charm. It is sheltered from direct elements because I hung it on an outside wall beneath a roof overhang. I didn't want to go to the trouble of linking it to the atomic clock, but it keeps accurate time nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: El Jefe

customer_reviews.title: Sort of thinks for itself
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how hard it would be for this clock to set itself in Florida. The Atomic clock satellite is in Colorado, and sometimes this clock goes a little wonky and just starts spinning. Then it stops on the correct time and works for several weeks and then goes wonky again. Still, it is out on my porch, and it's working and I love that it's large enough that I can see it, and it's very accurate - when it wants to be.
customer_reviews.author: Trudi

customer_reviews.title: First one didn't work. Manufacturer sent a new one, which seems fine.
customer_reviews.text: About 40 days after buying this clock, it changed itself to Pacific time and will no longer set to my time zone (Central). While I can get it to toggle between daylight savings and non-daylight savings, it insists on staying on Pacific time. I've tried all the reset tips on the manufacturer's website and contacted the manufacturer's customer support several times. I've yet to receive a response. UPDATE: The manufacturer did contact me - it just took a few extra days. After some email exchanges, they finally sent me a new clock, which is working perfectly so far.
customer_reviews.author: The Yaks

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and No Help from La Crosse.
customer_reviews.text: The clock was defective when I received it. The hour hand would "catch" on the temperature hand and not allow it to pass. Poor quality control for this product. I called La Crosse for tech support to see if there was a way I could free the hands. Never could reach a human and I left my number for a call back. As of this time, I have receive no call back from La Crosse. Thank goodness for Amazon's easy return policy. I'll just send it back, give the item the review it deserves, and order another brand from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel T Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, steel and glass outdoor clock.
customer_reviews.text: The clock is very good looking. Glass cover, rubber seals and auto setup. Only issue I’m having is that there is always a haze or fog on the clock in the early morning. Once the sun comes out it burns out the haze. Hope it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Need a clock for outside! This is the one you want!
customer_reviews.text: I Love this outdoor clock! It’s easy to read across my yard! Keeps Great time!
customer_reviews.author: Vic Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I use this clock on my screened porch. It is just the right size plus has the temperature and humidity gauge. I had another one, not this brand, and it quit working. This one is an atomic clock so I don't have to worry about whether it is the right time or not. It sets its self. Good thing because I always forget to reset in the spring and fall. I would buy this again and have always liked the La Crosse brand. Don't know how it would work on an unprotected space, but I'm not sure that many would exposed to severe weather. This one is great where I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Joy4719

customer_reviews.title: Rusted within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Thermometer rusted after 6 months. This "outside" clock was not correct in three description. I live in California, with zero rainfall. I'll make my next purchase elsewhere. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sooner Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this clock unless you want to have to replace every 2 years!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product!! I have had it hanging on my outdoor covered / screened in patio out of the sun for 2.5 years and it stopped working. Tried changing the battery , restarting it as per instructions , and manually tried to set it but nothing happens. It is stuck at 4:00. This is my second clock and same thing happened to my first one after about two years. I will not buy this clock for a third time! This clock should last longer than 2.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Santora

customer_reviews.title: Hands up!
customer_reviews.text: It looks great, seems to keep time when the minute hand stays on. The good news is that it's not too hard to take apart and fix when it falls off. The bad news is, it comes off. But for under for $40 it's still a good clock.
customer_reviews.author: UnionGator

customer_reviews.title: The dial/hand broke when arrived
customer_reviews.text: The dial broke off before we even used it. Return it for a refund. Can’t imagine it will last long if the material is so cheaply made. Got another brand instead
customer_reviews.author: A. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Update 5 years later and it is still just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Works well, looks great and is visible from a pretty good distance away. It's held up during torrential winds and rains and now we're checking out the heat resistance. So far so very good. I will bring it in during the winter. Well, I forgot to bring it in during the winter so it got rained on, snowed and sleeted on rather frequently. I must say it has held up beautifully. It still looks great and hasn't missed a beat time-wise. And now (2019) I don't bother to bring is in at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: La Crosse Technology WT-3181PL-INT 18 inch Atomic Outdoor Clock with Temperature & Humidity
product_meta.description:
Size:18"| Product Packaging:Frustration-Free PackagingManual Set Quartz time movement. Analog Temperature (F/C). Analog Hygrometer (%RH). Simple Operation: Insert 1 AA Alkaline Battery. Indoor/Outdoor use. Temperature Range: -10 F to +130 F(-23 C to +50 C). Humidity Range: 1-percent to 99-percent (%RH).

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

Factory Restart: 

1. Remove the battery from the clock for 15 minutes. 

2. Press the Manual Set Tab at least 20 times to clear all memory. 

3. Insert fresh Alkaline battery into the clock. 

4. The hands will spin to 12:00, 4:00 or 8:00 and wait for the WWVB time signal
feature_bullets: Works with 1 AA alkaline battery (not included) OR, additional battery
Radio controlled time. Automatically sets to exact time

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,334 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: 1 year repair warranty for any manufacture defects.
